pkgmetadata.longdescription: Model Based Treatment of Missing Data // Contains model-based treatment of missing data for regression models with missing values in covariates or the dependent variable using maximum likelihood or Bayesian estimation (Ibrahim et al., 2005; doi:10.1198/016214504000001844). T The regression model can be nonlinear (e.g., interaction quadratic effects or spline functions). Multilevel models with missing data in predictors is also available for Bayesian estimation. Substantive-model compatible multiple imputation can be also conducted.
